question: who caused to build qutub minar in delhi
api_result: The Qutub Minar in Delhi was commissioned by Qutb al-Din Aibak, the founder of the Delhi Sultanate, in 1193. It was built to celebrate the victory over the last Hindu kingdom in Delhi and to serve as a minaret for the nearby Quwwat-ul-Islam Mosque. The construction of the Qutub Minar was later continued by his successor, Iltutmish. The monument is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and is known for its impressive height and intricate architectural details.
